title: Between 1 July 2017 and 30 June 2018, will an armed group from Pakistan engage in a campaign that systematically kills 1,000 or more civilians in Pakistan?
preds: Based on general news and GJP consensus.
Based on general news and GJP consensus.
I can't see such a campaign done by the Taliban or even less by the government

Well, if the Pakistani government choose to obey the orders issued by M. Petits-Doigts the other night, the Taliban might get miffed enough to resume the slaughter of civilians.  On the other hand, it turns out that heads of state are not technically empowered to issue orders to other heads of state.  Not clear whether this has got through to Mr. Tangerine Man or not.
Pakistan is currently going through a phase of political instability but a campaign of mass killing is very unlikely.
Based on general news and GJP consensus.
